intro: Chorizema daviesioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf chorizema, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
